p: Finally, based on the age distribution of TB cases in our study, recent or ongoing transmission in high burden countries is implicated as the main contributor to the TB burden rather than disease reactivation (following longer latency periods) [ 47]. Additionally, an association with young age has been used as an epidemiological proxy for highly transmissible strains and faster rates of disease progression [ 48, 49]. In this study, we did not detect any differences in median age of TB patients infected with different lineages ( S5 Fig), an observation that could speak for high ongoing transmission rates in general, irrespective of lineage.
